title: Obama Presidential Library: NSC Correspondence Related To Death of Mikhail Lesin

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All information, analyses, summaries, assessments, transcripts, news clippings, email threads or similar records included in National Security Correspondence related to the death of Mikhail Lesin (Russian: Михаил Юрьевич Лесин) and the impact of his death. Time frame from the request is from the date of Lesin's widely reported death in Washington D.C. on November 5th of 2015 to the last day of the Obama Presidency on January 20th of 2017. 

Lesin was the creator behind the Kremlin-backed Russia Today ("RT") media network and was employed by Gazprom-Media. As a wealthy oligarch, he owned numerous properties in the United States and was connected to high profile figures in the entertainment industry. Theories about his death were later mentioned in the widely disseminated "Steele dossier."

Thank you for the Obama Presidential Library's commitment to transparency.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

title: Obama Presidential Library: Photographs From the Del Bosque Farm Tour in California in February 2014

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All photographs taken during President Obama's February 2014 tour of the Del Bosque Farm outside of Los Banos, California. This visit to a drought stricken farm field received a lot of news coverage: https://www.modbee.com/news/local/article3160728.html

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware
